Description: Rim sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery dinos; white slip; interior: reserved; exterior: on top of large flat rim, double guilloche pattern; below on body, single narrow band followed by dot and square pattern; below, painted decoration consisting goose (only head and neck remaining), to left; dot rosette, spiked maeander and part of floral motif as filling ornament.
Producer name: Attributed to: Painter of the Würzburg Chalices
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College Dublin, Department of Classics, Classical Museum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The sherd possibly belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1924,1201.2. Lemos places this sherd in the Würzburg Chalice Group and, more specifically, identifies it as decorated by the Painter of the Würzburg Chalices. The sherds from this group display stylistic similarities to the two Würzburg chalices, see Lemos 1991, pl. 20-1, no. 236-7. For parallels regarding the decoration, see University College London, UCL 339.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 247, no. 296, pl. 36)
Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 67)
Vickers 1971 / Some Unpublished Sherds from Naukratis in Dublin (p. 115, no. 2, pl. 13.B) (quoting an incorrect Ashmolean Museum accession number (G121.14))
CVA UCD & UCC / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Ireland, Fascicule 1: University College Dublin, University College Cork (p. 14, no. 4, pl. 11, no. 4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0016) (phase 2)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: AN1896-1908-G.121.16 (old Ashmolean Museum accession number)
